newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Basketball-Alaska wins, leads PBA finals 3-2.
newsitem.headline: Basketball-Alaska wins, leads PBA finals 3-2.

text.p: Alaska Milkmen moved to within a victory of winning the Philippine Basketball Association second conference finals by beating Formula Shell 70-63 on Friday night in the lowest scoring championship game in league history.
The Milkmen lead the best-of-seven series 3-2 and could wrap up the series in the sixth game scheduled for Sunday.
"This team is a shark and we can smell victory now," Alaska coach Tim Cone told reporters after the Milkmen repulsed a Shell rally in the last minute of the game.

American import Kenny Redfield sank a three-point shot to push Shell within a basket at 64-62 with 50 seconds left, but Alaska point guard Johnny Abarrientos countered with a jump shot to put the game beyond Shell's reach.
American Sean Chambers and Filipino Rene Hawkins topped Alaska scorers with 14 points while Redfield led the Shell attack with 24.
